title: Campus Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Azim Premji Foundation (Rudrapur) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: First of all written test was conducted consisting of 18 multiple choice questions of your subjects that is maths or physics or chemistry 2 hours were allotted for the test .Once you get selected then they will call you for  interview. The complete process almost took one and half month. Before appearing in examination study properly upto 12th standard concepts.
Interview Questions:
I had faced the Mathematics paper .3 questions were asked from geometry ,two from integration and 2 differentiation to from time distance average and 2 questions related to graph and statistics.
After clearing the first examination I was called for an interview at Rudrapur city Uttarakhand on April 2018 .
They are really generous to the candidate provide 3rd AC reimbursement for attending the interview .
Interview lasted for 50 minutes .Questions were asked related to behaviour and social subjects like general introduction famous things of my hometown Bikaner(Raj) and  about my family ,essentially of  national anthem in cinemas Kashmir issues and about my  religion beliefs and why do I want to join organisation instead of Technical sector ?and they told me to teach number system.
Yes for teaching the check how do you teach they give you a white board and a marker to teach topic the told me to this number system and prove that the sum of interior angles of a triangle is 180 degree. So keep your basics strong. And also speak with full confidence and speak clearly, don't show your confidence for the wrong answers and and don't try to argue with the interviewer.

title: General Occupation Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Azim Premji Foundation (Bengaluru) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The company is very eager to have new people on board since they are currently starved for them. The interview process is quick and they are very responsive over emails and phone calls. They currently need people to travel to rural parts of India. So they are eager to interview and hire since not many people want to take on that portfolio. 
Once they think the candidate is not viable for such a position, then the response gets lukewarm, and almost non-responsive.
